Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am requesting the following information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. If any information is unavailable, exempt, or beyond time/cost limits, please disregard these and provide the rest.
The total number of council-owned/operated CCTV cameras as of 2024 within your local authority area (if information for 2024 is not yet available, please provide the most up-to-date numbers).
I do not need the location of these CCTV cameras, just a total number of CCTV cameras currently in operation within your local authority area.
Please let me know if you have any questions or require additional clarification.
Yours faithfully,
Jamie Dixon

Dear Jamie Dixon,
Thank you for your request for information relating to number of
council-owned/operated CCTV cameras which we received on 22/07/2024.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 20/08/2024. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Jamie Dixon,
Thank you for your request for information relating to number of
council-owned/operated CCTV cameras which we received on 22/07/2024.
We apologise for the delay in responding.
Please find our response.
Our CCTV control room has 206 CCTV cameras which includes the 53 cameras
inside Moor Markets.
However, Sheffield City Council has CCTV cameras in various sites which
consists of a DVR/NVR and multiple cameras internal & external.
These are:
• Tower Blocks
• Libraries – 5 cameras across the city libraries.
• Cemetries
• SCC Works Depots
• Medico Legal
• Housing Offices
• Parks
• Residential Homes Adults & Young persons
• Older Peoples Independent Living Accommodation
• Family Hubs
• Other Council Buildings i.e.. Town Hall, Howden House, Moorfoot etc
• Fly-tip cameras
• EV Charging Points – Pending
Housing operates 663 cameras across their 51 sites.
Please note that our figures only relate to council-owned devices. We are
not accounting for Ring Bells in social housing; private CCTV that we have
become aware of in our community anti-social behaviour work; nor
commercial CCTV which we may have requisitioned for community safety.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
